abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Credit Project
            for the Kyrgyz Republic aims to help implement reform
            measures under the Consolidation Structural Adjustment
            Credit (CSAC). The project has four components. The first
            improves the business environment: it finances the services
            of an expatriate consultant who will implement the decrees
            on improving start-up procedures and business inspections;
            funds a diagnostic analysis and surveys; and thereafter, it
            simplifies business procedures, including business
            registration. The second component helps revenue
            mobilization, provides financing for an international
            customs advisor, and supports the customs modernization and
            reform. The third component strengthens the state energy
            agency in its institutional and technical capacity, thus
            enabling it to prepare detailed market rules governing the
            operation of the unbundled electricity and gas sectors; and
            to monitor rule implementation. This component also assists
            the Government's efforts to privatize the
            country's gas and electricity distribution companies;
            strengthens the financial viability of the gas company;
            helps carry out an audit; helps implement, monitor, and
            assess a social assistance compensation strategy for urban
            areas undergoing significant household utility tax
            increases; supports the public relations campaign; and
            purchases gas meters, parts, materials, and equipment. The
            fourth component supports project management, other
            technical assistance, and contingencies.
